Authors: O-Chul Kwon, Young-Jin Kim , Chang-Soo Lee
Title:
Taxonomic position and the species identity of the cultivated
Yeongji “Ganoderma lucidum” in Korea
Keywords:
Ganoderma lingzh, Ganoderma sichuanens, ITS rRNA gene,
Phylogeny, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Ganoderma lucidum has a long history for traditional
medicine in Asian countries. However, taxonomy of Ganoderma species
remains controversial, since it was initially classified on the basis of
morphological characteristics. Recently, Ganoderma sichuanense and
Ganoderma lingzhi was proposed as a reâ“proposed name for Ganoderma
lucidum in China. Likewise, all strains of the Korean âG. lucidumâ were
clustered into one group together with G. sichuanense and G. lingzhi
from China, when a phylogenetic analysis was undertaken based on the ITS
rRNA gene sequences of the Ganoderma species. However, Europe and North
American strains which are regarded as true G. lucidum were positioned
in clearly different group. Based on these results, reâ“consideration of
naming Korean cultivated Yeongji âG. lucidumâ should be needed.
